00082 /* for internal use, when starting and ending python scripts */
00083 
00084 /* in case a python script triggers another python call, stop bpy_context_clear from invalidating */
00085 static int py_call_level = 0;
00086 BPy_StructRNA *bpy_context_module = NULL; /* for fast access */
00087 
00088 // #define TIME_PY_RUN // simple python tests. prints on exit.
00089 
00090 #ifdef TIME_PY_RUN
00091 #include "PIL_time.h"
00092 static int     bpy_timer_count = 0;
00093 static double  bpy_timer;   /* time since python starts */
00094 static double  bpy_timer_run;   /* time for each python script run */
00095 static double  bpy_timer_run_tot;   /* accumulate python runs */
00096 #endif
00097 
00098 /* use for updating while a python script runs - in case of file load */
00099 void bpy_context_update(bContext *C)
00100 {
00101     /* don't do this from a non-main (e.g. render) thread, it can cause a race
00102      * condition on C->data.recursion. ideal solution would be to disable
00103      * context entirely from non-main threads, but that's more complicated */
00104     if (!BLI_thread_is_main())
00105         return;
00106 
00107     BPy_SetContext(C);
00108     bpy_import_main_set(CTX_data_main(C));
00109     BPY_modules_update(C); /* can give really bad results if this isn't here */
00110 }
00111 
00112 void bpy_context_set(bContext *C, PyGILState_STATE *gilstate)
00113 {
00114     py_call_level++;
00115 
00116     if (gilstate)
00117         *gilstate = PyGILState_Ensure();
00118 
00119     if (py_call_level == 1) {
00120         bpy_context_update(C);
00121 
00122 #ifdef TIME_PY_RUN
00123         if (bpy_timer_count == 0) {
00124             /* record time from the beginning */
00125             bpy_timer = PIL_check_seconds_timer();
00126             bpy_timer_run = bpy_timer_run_tot = 0.0;
00127         }
00128         bpy_timer_run = PIL_check_seconds_timer();
00129 
00130 
00131         bpy_timer_count++;
00132 #endif
00133     }
00134 }
00135 
00136 /* context should be used but not now because it causes some bugs */
00137 void bpy_context_clear(bContext *UNUSED(C), PyGILState_STATE *gilstate)
00138 {
00139     py_call_level--;
00140 
00141     if (gilstate)
00142         PyGILState_Release(*gilstate);
00143 
00144     if (py_call_level < 0) {
00145         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Python context internal state bug. this should not happen!\n");
00146     }
00147     else if (py_call_level == 0) {
00148         /* XXX - Calling classes currently wont store the context :\,
00149          * cant set NULL because of this. but this is very flakey still. */
00150 #if 0
00151         BPy_SetContext(NULL);
00152         bpy_import_main_set(NULL);
00153 #endif
00154 
00155 #ifdef TIME_PY_RUN
00156         bpy_timer_run_tot += PIL_check_seconds_timer() - bpy_timer_run;
00157         bpy_timer_count++;
00158 #endif
00159 
00160     }
00161 }

00163 void BPY_text_free_code(Text *text)
00164 {
00165     if (text->compiled) {
00166         Py_DECREF((PyObject *)text->compiled);
00167         text->compiled = NULL;
00168     }
00169 }

00171 void BPY_modules_update(bContext *C)
00172 {
00173 #if 0 // slow, this runs all the time poll, draw etc 100's of time a sec.
00174     PyObject *mod = PyImport_ImportModuleLevel("bpy", NULL, NULL, NULL, 0);
00175     PyModule_AddObject(mod, "data", BPY_rna_module());
00176     PyModule_AddObject(mod, "types", BPY_rna_types()); // atm this does not need updating
00177 #endif
00178 
00179     /* refreshes the main struct */
00180     BPY_update_rna_module();
00181     bpy_context_module->ptr.data = (void *)C;
00182 }

00220 /* call BPY_context_set first */
00221 void BPY_python_start(int argc, const char **argv)
00222 {
00223 #ifndef WITH_PYTHON_MODULE
00224     PyThreadState *py_tstate = NULL;
00225 
00226     /* not essential but nice to set our name */
00227     static wchar_t program_path_wchar[FILE_MAX]; /* python holds a reference */
00228     BLI_strncpy_wchar_from_utf8(program_path_wchar, BLI_program_path(), sizeof(program_path_wchar) / sizeof(wchar_t));
00229     Py_SetProgramName(program_path_wchar);
00230 
00231     /* must run before python initializes */
00232     PyImport_ExtendInittab(bpy_internal_modules);
00233 
00234     /* allow to use our own included python */
00235     PyC_SetHomePath(BLI_get_folder(BLENDER_SYSTEM_PYTHON, NULL));
00236 
00237     /* without this the sys.stdout may be set to 'ascii'
00238      * (it is on my system at least), where printing unicode values will raise
00239      * an error, this is highly annoying, another stumbling block for devs,
00240      * so use a more relaxed error handler and enforce utf-8 since the rest of
00241      * blender is utf-8 too - campbell */
00242     BLI_setenv("PYTHONIOENCODING", "utf-8:surrogateescape");
00243 
00244     /* Python 3.2 now looks for '2.xx/python/include/python3.2d/pyconfig.h' to
00245      * parse from the 'sysconfig' module which is used by 'site',
00246      * so for now disable site. alternatively we could copy the file. */
00247     Py_NoSiteFlag = 1;
00248 
00249     Py_Initialize();
00250 
00251     // PySys_SetArgv(argc, argv); // broken in py3, not a huge deal
00252     /* sigh, why do python guys not have a (char **) version anymore? */
00253     {
00254         int i;
00255         PyObject *py_argv = PyList_New(argc);
00256         for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
00257             /* should fix bug #20021 - utf path name problems, by replacing
00258              * PyUnicode_FromString, with this one */
00259             PyList_SET_ITEM(py_argv, i, PyC_UnicodeFromByte(argv[i]));
00260         }
00261 
00262         PySys_SetObject("argv", py_argv);
00263         Py_DECREF(py_argv);
00264     }
00265     
00266     /* Initialize thread support (also acquires lock) */
00267     PyEval_InitThreads();
00268 #else
00269     (void)argc;
00270     (void)argv;
00271 
00272     /* must run before python initializes */
00273     PyImport_ExtendInittab(bpy_internal_modules);
00274 #endif
00275 
00276     bpy_intern_string_init();
00277 
00278     /* bpy.* and lets us import it */
00279     BPy_init_modules();
00280 
00281     bpy_import_init(PyEval_GetBuiltins());
00282     
00283     pyrna_alloc_types();
00284 
00285 #ifndef WITH_PYTHON_MODULE
00286     /* py module runs atexit when bpy is freed */
00287     BPY_atexit_register(); /* this can init any time */
00288 
00289     py_tstate = PyGILState_GetThisThreadState();
00290     PyEval_ReleaseThread(py_tstate);
00291 #endif
00292 }
00293 
00294 void BPY_python_end(void)
00295 {
00296     // fprintf(stderr, "Ending Python!\n");
00297 
00298     PyGILState_Ensure(); /* finalizing, no need to grab the state */
00299     
00300     // free other python data.
00301     pyrna_free_types();
00302 
00303     /* clear all python data from structs */
00304 
00305     bpy_intern_string_exit();
00306 
00307 #ifndef WITH_PYTHON_MODULE
00308     BPY_atexit_unregister(); /* without this we get recursive calls to WM_exit */
00309 #endif
00310 
00311     Py_Finalize();
00312     
00313 #ifdef TIME_PY_RUN
00314     // measure time since py started
00315     bpy_timer = PIL_check_seconds_timer() - bpy_timer;
00316 
00317     printf("*bpy stats* - ");
00318     printf("tot exec: %d,  ", bpy_timer_count);
00319     printf("tot run: %.4fsec,  ", bpy_timer_run_tot);
00320     if (bpy_timer_count > 0)
00321         printf("average run: %.6fsec,  ", (bpy_timer_run_tot / bpy_timer_count));
00322 
00323     if (bpy_timer > 0.0)
00324         printf("tot usage %.4f%%", (bpy_timer_run_tot / bpy_timer) * 100.0);
00325 
00326     printf("\n");
00327 
00328     // fprintf(stderr, "Ending Python Done!\n");
00329 
00330 #endif
00331 
00332 }
00333 
00334 static void python_script_error_jump_text(struct Text *text)
00335 {
00336     int lineno;
00337     int offset;
00338     python_script_error_jump(text->id.name + 2, &lineno, &offset);
00339     if (lineno != -1) {
00340         /* select the line with the error */
00341         txt_move_to(text, lineno - 1, INT_MAX, FALSE);
00342         txt_move_to(text, lineno - 1, offset, TRUE);
00343     }
00344 }
00345 
00346 /* super annoying, undo _PyModule_Clear(), bug [#23871] */
00347 #define PYMODULE_CLEAR_WORKAROUND
00348 
00349 #ifdef PYMODULE_CLEAR_WORKAROUND
00350 /* bad!, we should never do this, but currently only safe way I could find to keep namespace.
00351  * from being cleared. - campbell */
00352 typedef struct {
00353     PyObject_HEAD
00354     PyObject *md_dict;
00355     /* ommit other values, we only want the dict. */
00356 } PyModuleObject;
00357 #endif
00358 
00359 static int python_script_exec(bContext *C, const char *fn, struct Text *text,
00360                               struct ReportList *reports, const short do_jump)
00361 {
00362     PyObject *main_mod = NULL;
00363     PyObject *py_dict = NULL, *py_result = NULL;
00364     PyGILState_STATE gilstate;
00365 
00366     BLI_assert(fn || text);
00367 
00368     if (fn == NULL && text == NULL) {
00369         return 0;
00370     }
00371 
00372     bpy_context_set(C, &gilstate);
00373 
00374     PyC_MainModule_Backup(&main_mod);
00375 
00376     if (text) {
00377         char fn_dummy[FILE_MAXDIR];
00378         bpy_text_filename_get(fn_dummy, sizeof(fn_dummy), text);
00379 
00380         if (text->compiled == NULL) {   /* if it wasn't already compiled, do it now */
00381             char *buf = txt_to_buf(text);
00382 
00383             text->compiled = Py_CompileString(buf, fn_dummy, Py_file_input);
00384 
00385             MEM_freeN(buf);
00386 
00387             if (PyErr_Occurred()) {
00388                 if (do_jump) {
00389                     python_script_error_jump_text(text);
00390                 }
00391                 BPY_text_free_code(text);
00392             }
00393         }
00394 
00395         if (text->compiled) {
00396             py_dict = PyC_DefaultNameSpace(fn_dummy);
00397             py_result =  PyEval_EvalCode(text->compiled, py_dict, py_dict);
00398         }
00399 
00400     }
00401     else {
00402         FILE *fp = BLI_fopen(fn, "r");
00403 
00404         if (fp) {
00405             py_dict = PyC_DefaultNameSpace(fn);
00406 
00407 #ifdef _WIN32
00408             /* Previously we used PyRun_File to run directly the code on a FILE
00409              * object, but as written in the Python/C API Ref Manual, chapter 2,
00410              * 'FILE structs for different C libraries can be different and
00411              * incompatible'.
00412              * So now we load the script file data to a buffer */
00413             {
00414                 char *pystring;
00415 
00416                 fclose(fp);
00417 
00418                 pystring = MEM_mallocN(strlen(fn) + 32, "pystring");
00419                 pystring[0] = '\0';
00420                 sprintf(pystring, "exec(open(r'%s').read())", fn);
00421                 py_result = PyRun_String(pystring, Py_file_input, py_dict, py_dict);
00422                 MEM_freeN(pystring);
00423             }
00424 #else
00425             py_result = PyRun_File(fp, fn, Py_file_input, py_dict, py_dict);
00426             fclose(fp);
00427 #endif
00428         }
00429         else {
00430             PyErr_Format(PyExc_IOError,
00431                          "Python file \"%s\" could not be opened: %s",
00432                          fn, strerror(errno));
00433             py_result = NULL;
00434         }
00435     }
00436 
00437     if (!py_result) {
00438         if (text) {
00439             if (do_jump) {
00440                 python_script_error_jump_text(text);
00441             }
00442         }
00443         BPy_errors_to_report(reports);
00444     }
00445     else {
00446         Py_DECREF(py_result);
00447     }
00448 
00449     if (py_dict) {
00450 #ifdef PYMODULE_CLEAR_WORKAROUND
00451         PyModuleObject *mmod = (PyModuleObject *)PyDict_GetItemString(PyThreadState_GET()->interp->modules, "__main__");
00452         PyObject *dict_back = mmod->md_dict;
00453         /* freeing the module will clear the namespace,
00454          * gives problems running classes defined in this namespace being used later. */
00455         mmod->md_dict = NULL;
00456         Py_DECREF(dict_back);
00457 #endif
00458 
00459 #undef PYMODULE_CLEAR_WORKAROUND
00460     }
00461 
00462     PyC_MainModule_Restore(main_mod);
00463 
00464     bpy_context_clear(C, &gilstate);
00465 
00466     return (py_result != NULL);
00467 }
00468 
00469 /* Can run a file or text block */
00470 int BPY_filepath_exec(bContext *C, const char *filepath, struct ReportList *reports)
00471 {
00472     return python_script_exec(C, filepath, NULL, reports, FALSE);
00473 }

00476 int BPY_text_exec(bContext *C, struct Text *text, struct ReportList *reports, const short do_jump)

00478     return python_script_exec(C, NULL, text, reports, do_jump);

00481 void BPY_DECREF(void *pyob_ptr)
00482 {
00483     PyGILState_STATE gilstate = PyGILState_Ensure();
00484     Py_DECREF((PyObject *)pyob_ptr);
00485     PyGILState_Release(gilstate);
00486 }
00487 
00488 /* return -1 on error, else 0 */
00489 int BPY_button_exec(bContext *C, const char *expr, double *value, const short verbose)
00490 {
00491     PyGILState_STATE gilstate;
00492     PyObject *py_dict, *mod, *retval;
00493     int error_ret = 0;
00494     PyObject *main_mod = NULL;
00495     
00496     if (!value || !expr) return -1;
00497 
00498     if (expr[0] == '\0') {
00499         *value = 0.0;
00500         return error_ret;
00501     }
00502 
00503     bpy_context_set(C, &gilstate);
00504 
00505     PyC_MainModule_Backup(&main_mod);
00506 
00507     py_dict = PyC_DefaultNameSpace("<blender button>");
00508 
00509     mod = PyImport_ImportModule("math");
00510     if (mod) {
00511         PyDict_Merge(py_dict, PyModule_GetDict(mod), 0); /* 0 - don't overwrite existing values */
00512         Py_DECREF(mod);
00513     }
00514     else { /* highly unlikely but possibly */
00515         PyErr_Print();
00516         PyErr_Clear();
00517     }
00518     
00519     retval = PyRun_String(expr, Py_eval_input, py_dict, py_dict);
00520     
00521     if (retval == NULL) {
00522         error_ret = -1;
00523     }
00524     else {
00525         double val;
00526 
00527         if (PyTuple_Check(retval)) {
00528             /* Users my have typed in 10km, 2m
00529              * add up all values */
00530             int i;
00531             val = 0.0;
00532 
00533             for (i = 0; i < PyTuple_GET_SIZE(retval); i++) {
00534                 val += PyFloat_AsDouble(PyTuple_GET_ITEM(retval, i));
00535             }
00536         }
00537         else {
00538             val = PyFloat_AsDouble(retval);
00539         }
00540         Py_DECREF(retval);
00541         
00542         if (val == -1 && PyErr_Occurred()) {
00543             error_ret = -1;
00544         }
00545         else if (!finite(val)) {
00546             *value = 0.0;
00547         }
00548         else {
00549             *value = val;
00550         }
00551     }
00552     
00553     if (error_ret) {
00554         if (verbose) {
00555             BPy_errors_to_report(CTX_wm_reports(C));
00556         }
00557         else {
00558             PyErr_Clear();
00559         }
00560     }
00561 
00562     PyC_MainModule_Backup(&main_mod);
00563     
00564     bpy_context_clear(C, &gilstate);
00565     
00566     return error_ret;
00567 }
00568 
00569 int BPY_string_exec(bContext *C, const char *expr)
00570 {
00571     PyGILState_STATE gilstate;
00572     PyObject *main_mod = NULL;
00573     PyObject *py_dict, *retval;
00574     int error_ret = 0;
00575     Main *bmain_back; /* XXX, quick fix for release (Copy Settings crash), needs further investigation */
00576 
00577     if (!expr) return -1;
00578 
00579     if (expr[0] == '\0') {
00580         return error_ret;
00581     }
00582 
00583     bpy_context_set(C, &gilstate);
00584 
00585     PyC_MainModule_Backup(&main_mod);
00586 
00587     py_dict = PyC_DefaultNameSpace("<blender string>");
00588 
00589     bmain_back = bpy_import_main_get();
00590     bpy_import_main_set(CTX_data_main(C));
00591 
00592     retval = PyRun_String(expr, Py_eval_input, py_dict, py_dict);
00593 
00594     bpy_import_main_set(bmain_back);
00595 
00596     if (retval == NULL) {
00597         error_ret = -1;
00598 
00599         BPy_errors_to_report(CTX_wm_reports(C));
00600     }
00601     else {
00602         Py_DECREF(retval);
00603     }
00604 
00605     PyC_MainModule_Restore(main_mod);
00606 
00607     bpy_context_clear(C, &gilstate);
00608     
00609     return error_ret;
00610 }
00611 
00612 
00613 void BPY_modules_load_user(bContext *C)
00614 {
00615     PyGILState_STATE gilstate;
00616     Main *bmain = CTX_data_main(C);
00617     Text *text;
00618 
00619     /* can happen on file load */
00620     if (bmain == NULL)
00621         return;
00622 
00623     /* update pointers since this can run from a nested script
00624      * on file load */
00625     if (py_call_level) {
00626         bpy_context_update(C);
00627     }
00628 
00629     bpy_context_set(C, &gilstate);
00630 
00631     for (text = CTX_data_main(C)->text.first; text; text = text->id.next) {
00632         if (text->flags & TXT_ISSCRIPT && BLI_testextensie(text->id.name + 2, ".py")) {
00633             if (!(G.f & G_SCRIPT_AUTOEXEC)) {
00634                 printf("scripts disabled for \"%s\", skipping '%s'\n", bmain->name, text->id.name + 2);
00635             }
00636             else {
00637                 PyObject *module = bpy_text_import(text);
00638 
00639                 if (module == NULL) {
00640                     PyErr_Print();
00641                     PyErr_Clear();
00642                 }
00643                 else {
00644                     Py_DECREF(module);
00645                 }
00646             }
00647         }
00648     }
00649     bpy_context_clear(C, &gilstate);
00650 }
00651 
00652 int BPY_context_member_get(bContext *C, const char *member, bContextDataResult *result)
00653 {
00654     PyObject *pyctx = (PyObject *)CTX_py_dict_get(C);
00655     PyObject *item = PyDict_GetItemString(pyctx, member);
00656     PointerRNA *ptr = NULL;
00657     int done = 0;
00658 
00659     if (item == NULL) {
00660         /* pass */
00661     }
00662     else if (item == Py_None) {
00663         /* pass */
00664     }
00665     else if (BPy_StructRNA_Check(item)) {
00666         ptr = &(((BPy_StructRNA *)item)->ptr);
00667 
00668         //result->ptr = ((BPy_StructRNA *)item)->ptr;
00669         CTX_data_pointer_set(result, ptr->id.data, ptr->type, ptr->data);
00670         done = 1;
00671     }
00672     else if (PySequence_Check(item)) {
00673         PyObject *seq_fast = PySequence_Fast(item, "bpy_context_get sequence conversion");
00674         if (seq_fast == NULL) {
00675             PyErr_Print();
00676             PyErr_Clear();
00677         }
00678         else {
00679             int len = PySequence_Fast_GET_SIZE(seq_fast);
00680             int i;
00681             for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
00682                 PyObject *list_item = PySequence_Fast_GET_ITEM(seq_fast, i);
00683 
00684                 if (BPy_StructRNA_Check(list_item)) {
00685 #if 0
00686                     CollectionPointerLink *link = MEM_callocN(sizeof(CollectionPointerLink), "bpy_context_get");
00687                     link->ptr = ((BPy_StructRNA *)item)->ptr;
00688                     BLI_addtail(&result->list, link);
00689 #endif
00690                     ptr = &(((BPy_StructRNA *)list_item)->ptr);
00691                     CTX_data_list_add(result, ptr->id.data, ptr->type, ptr->data);
00692                 }
00693                 else {
00694                     printf("List item not a valid type\n");
00695                 }
00696 
00697             }
00698             Py_DECREF(seq_fast);
00699 
00700             done = 1;
00701         }
00702     }
00703 
00704     if (done == 0) {
00705         if (item) printf("PyContext '%s' not a valid type\n", member);
00706         else      printf("PyContext '%s' not found\n", member);
00707     }
00708     else {
00709         if (G.debug & G_DEBUG_PYTHON) {
00710             printf("PyContext '%s' found\n", member);
00711         }
00712     }
00713 
00714     return done;
00715 }
00716 
00717 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON_MODULE
00718 #include "BLI_fileops.h"
00719 /* TODO, reloading the module isn't functional at the moment. */
00720 
00721 static void bpy_module_free(void *mod);
00722 extern int main_python_enter(int argc, const char **argv);
00723 extern void main_python_exit(void);
00724 static struct PyModuleDef bpy_proxy_def = {
00725     PyModuleDef_HEAD_INIT,
00726     "bpy",  /* m_name */
00727     NULL,  /* m_doc */
00728     0,  /* m_size */
00729     NULL,  /* m_methods */
00730     NULL,  /* m_reload */
00731     NULL,  /* m_traverse */
00732     NULL,  /* m_clear */
00733     bpy_module_free,  /* m_free */
00734 };
00735 
00736 typedef struct {
00737     PyObject_HEAD
00738     /* Type-specific fields go here. */
00739     PyObject *mod;
00740 } dealloc_obj;
00741 
00742 /* call once __file__ is set */
00743 void bpy_module_delay_init(PyObject *bpy_proxy)
00744 {
00745     const int argc = 1;
00746     const char *argv[2];
00747 
00748     /* updating the module dict below will loose the reference to __file__ */
00749     PyObject *filename_obj = PyModule_GetFilenameObject(bpy_proxy);
00750 
00751     const char *filename_rel = _PyUnicode_AsString(filename_obj); /* can be relative */
00752     char filename_abs[1024];
00753 
00754     BLI_strncpy(filename_abs, filename_rel, sizeof(filename_abs));
00755     BLI_path_cwd(filename_abs);
00756 
00757     argv[0] = filename_abs;
00758     argv[1] = NULL;
00759     
00760     // printf("module found %s\n", argv[0]);
00761 
00762     main_python_enter(argc, argv);
00763 
00764     /* initialized in BPy_init_modules() */
00765     PyDict_Update(PyModule_GetDict(bpy_proxy), PyModule_GetDict(bpy_package_py));
00766 }
00767 
00768 static void dealloc_obj_dealloc(PyObject *self);
00769 
00770 static PyTypeObject dealloc_obj_Type = {{{0}}};
00771 
00772 /* use our own dealloc so we can free a property if we use one */
00773 static void dealloc_obj_dealloc(PyObject *self)
00774 {
00775     bpy_module_delay_init(((dealloc_obj *)self)->mod);
00776 
00777     /* Note, for subclassed PyObjects we cant just call PyObject_DEL() directly or it will crash */
00778     dealloc_obj_Type.tp_free(self);
00779 }
00780 
00781 PyMODINIT_FUNC
00782 PyInit_bpy(void)
00783 {
00784     PyObject *bpy_proxy = PyModule_Create(&bpy_proxy_def);
00785     
00786     /* Problem:
00787      * 1) this init function is expected to have a private member defined - 'md_def'
00788      *    but this is only set for C defined modules (not py packages)
00789      *    so we cant return 'bpy_package_py' as is.
00790      *
00791      * 2) there is a 'bpy' C module for python to load which is basically all of blender,
00792      *    and there is scripts/bpy/__init__.py, 
00793      *    we may end up having to rename this module so there is no naming conflict here eg:
00794      *    'from blender import bpy'
00795      *
00796      * 3) we don't know the filename at this point, workaround by assigning a dummy value
00797      *    which calls back when its freed so the real loading can take place.
00798      */
00799 
00800     /* assign an object which is freed after __file__ is assigned */
00801     dealloc_obj *dob;
00802     
00803     /* assign dummy type */
00804     dealloc_obj_Type.tp_name = "dealloc_obj";
00805     dealloc_obj_Type.tp_basicsize = sizeof(dealloc_obj);
00806     dealloc_obj_Type.tp_dealloc = dealloc_obj_dealloc;
00807     dealloc_obj_Type.tp_flags = Py_TPFLAGS_DEFAULT;
00808     
00809     if (PyType_Ready(&dealloc_obj_Type) < 0)
00810         return NULL;
00811 
00812     dob = (dealloc_obj *) dealloc_obj_Type.tp_alloc(&dealloc_obj_Type, 0);
00813     dob->mod = bpy_proxy; /* borrow */
00814     PyModule_AddObject(bpy_proxy, "__file__", (PyObject *)dob); /* borrow */
00815 
00816     return bpy_proxy;
00817 }
00818 
00819 static void bpy_module_free(void *UNUSED(mod))
00820 {
00821     main_python_exit();
00822 }
00823 
00824 #endif
